subject: RE: Passing parameters to methods (was RE: [junit] Re: Can I create a dynamic JUnit ?  (in Cactus Framework))
msgSnippet: ... I imagine that there could be a language that replaced parameter passing by an alternative mechanism, without being unpleasant. Of course to someone used
messageBody:
> Basically, imagine that Java didn't let you pass parameters
> to methods... not very pleasant, uh?

I imagine that there could be a language that replaced parameter passing by
an alternative mechanism, without being unpleasant. Of course to someone
used to parameter passing, it might look unpleasant at first, and he
probably would need to approach it with an open mind and experiment a lot
before being able to assess it fairly.

It is imaginable a creator of a language with parameter passing, who sees
himself as the competition to the parameterless language, might not be very
motivated to really invest the time to understand hit. He might also not be
the best source of credible comments about it...

Cheers, Ilja
